meanings.sent1: The artist used carmines to paint the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The carmines of the roses brightened up the garden.
meanings.sent3: The carmines of the strawberries made them look like little jewels.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned carmines with embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The carmines of the fire blazed against the night sky.

meanings.definition: A pigment or dye of a vivid red color
meanings.sent1: The painter mixed carmines with other colors to create a unique shade.
meanings.sent2: The carmines in the fabric gave it a rich and vibrant look.
meanings.sent3: The carmines spilled on the tablecloth looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The carmines of the dye stood out boldly against the white cloth.
meanings.sent5: The carmines of the paint added depth to the portrait.

meanings.definition: A small South American bird with mainly red plumage
meanings.sent1: The carmines chirped melodiously in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The carmines fluttered gracefully from branch to branch.
meanings.sent3: The carmines' bright feathers made it easy to spot in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The carmines' song filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent5: The carmines' red plumage contrasted beautifully with the green leaves.
